extendedIngredients.original: 1/2 tsp ground mixed peppercorns, plus more for sprinkling
extendedIngredients.originalName: ground mixed peppercorns, plus more for sprinkling

title: Pan-roasted Swordfish Steaks With Mixed-peppercorn Butter
summary: Pan-roasted Swordfish Steaks With Mixed-peppercorn Butter is a gluten free, primal, and pescatarian main course. This recipe makes 4 servings with 379 calories, 34g of protein, and 26g of fat each. For $3.98 per serving, this recipe covers 24% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It will be a hit at your valentin day event. 155 people have made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 25 minutes. If you have butter, parsley, swordfish fillets, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the lemon peel you could follow this main course with the Lemon Syrup Cake with Berries and Lemon-Curd Cream as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 83%, this dish is amazing. Similar recipes include Pan-roasted Swordfish Steaks With Mixed-peppercorn Butter, Pan Roasted Swordfish Steaks, and Peppercorn-Crusted Strip Steaks with Seasoned Butter.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve
productMatches.description: An intense golden color with hints of ocher, the wine has a nose of ripe fruit, quince. In the mouth the attack is both supple and full, with notes of honey and spices. The final perfectly balances sugar and acidity.Pair this wine alongside pan-fried foie gras, grilled or roasted white meats (pork, veal), rabbit, poultry in cream sauce, smoked fish, mushroom dishes such as risotto.

instructions: Preparation                                        Preheat oven to 400F. Mash butter, parsley, garlic, 1/2 teaspoon ground mixed peppercorns, and lemon peel in small bowl. Season to taste with salt.                                                                            Heat oil in heavy large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle swordfish with salt and ground mixed peppercorns. Add swordfish to skillet. Cook until browned, about 3 minutes. Turn swordfish over and transfer to oven. Roast until just cooked through, about 10 minutes longer. Transfer swordfish to plates. Add seasoned butter to same skillet. Cook over medium-high heat, scraping up browned bits, until melted and bubbling. Pour butter sauce over swordfish and serve.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400F. Mash butter, parsley, garlic, 1/2 teaspoon ground mixed peppercorns, and lemon peel in small bowl. Season to taste with salt.
Heat oil in heavy large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat.
Sprinkle swordfish with salt and ground mixed peppercorns.
Add swordfish to skillet. Cook until browned, about 3 minutes. Turn swordfish over and transfer to oven. Roast until just cooked through, about 10 minutes longer.
Add seasoned butter to same skillet. Cook over medium-high heat, scraping up browned bits, until melted and bubbling.
Pour butter sauce over swordfish and serve.
